text: Israel Goodman Young or Izzy Young (26 March 1928 â€“ 4 February 2019) was an American-Swedish folklorist, businessman, columnist and writer. He was known in the world of folk music. He was the former owner of the Folklore Center in Greenwich Village, New York. He owned and operated the Folklore Centrum store in Stockholm. Bob Dylan relates in his memoirs, Chronicles, how he spent time at the Center, where Young allowed him to sit in the backroom of the store, listening to folk music records and reading books."Bob Dylan's Carnegie Hall Debut: A Half Century Later" , carnegiehall.org, The Carnegie Hall Corporation, Friday, November 4, 2011. Young was born in New York City. He died on 4 February 2019 in Stockholm at the age of 90. ==References== ==Other websites== *Acoustic evenings at Folklore Centrum * *Bob Dylan: "Talking Folklore Center" *Izzy Young's Folklore Center Category:1928 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American columnists Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:Writers from New York City Category:Writers from Stockholm
title: Izzy Young
